projects.avlg

Class AVLGTreeTests

  • java.lang.Object
    • projects.avlg.AVLGTreeTests

  • public class AVLGTreeTests
extends java.lang.Object

    A testing suite for the second project of CMSC420, Data Structures, in CS UMD, Spring 2018. The theme of the project is AVL-G Trees. The structure is tested against Integers, with easily tune-able values for G as well as tune-able stress-testing of a pre-defined number of pairwise distinct Integers.

    The testBalancedInsertionsAVLx() and The testBalancedInsertionsAVLx() tests all test against expected behavior of the following eight operations:

    1. Single left rotation about the root.
    2. Single right rotation about the root.
    3. RL rotation about the root.
    4. LR rotation about the root.
    5. LR rotation about the root's left child.
    6. RL rotation about the root's left child.
    7. LR rotation about the root's right child.
    8. RL rotation about the root's right child.
    Author:
    Jason Filippou

        public void testEmptyTree()
        Make sure that an empty tree is reported as such by the code, in terms of both AVLGTree.isEmpty() and AVLGTree.getCount().

      • testTwoInsertionsAndDeletions

        public void testTwoInsertionsAndDeletions()
        A simple test which inserts two keys and then deletes them. Tests for height, count, emptiness, and even polls the root after all 4 different operations.

      • testBalancedInsertionsAVL1

        public void testBalancedInsertionsAVL1()
        Generate 8 different insertion orders, each of which should lead to the 8 operations described in the class' docs. Perform tests against a maximum absolute imbalance parameter of 1.
